content: As mathlib4 grows, should we put .DS_Store in mathlib4's .gitignore just to be safe?
Ideally everyone would have .DS_Store ignored locally, but I'm wondering if there's any harm to just making sure no .DS_Store's creep in accidentally.
it seems like a mac specific issue that should be fixed in a global git config option
because that reasoning applies to every .gitignore in the world otherwise
Usually, people put OS-specific and editor-specific patterns in their global gitignore and project-specifc patterns in project_root/.gitignore.

for a project with this many contributors, I just wonder why we’d want to rely on everyone having their personal gitignore set up properly. I expect at least some contributors to mathlib will be mathematicians making a foray into formalization, who might not even use git otherwise.

I don’t know…why not have .DS_Store in every very large open-source repo’s gitignore? it just seems to me like it protects against nuisances down the road and costs very little, even if it’s a jarring aesthetic choice. but I don’t want to die on this hill, so I’ll just leave that as my two cents :)
I suggest that we discuss it after a mathematician makes a PR with .DS_Store.
It shouldn't really be a problem. It will be noticed in PR reviews. And that will cause those unaware of git configuration to learn about it.

hmm, I guess that’s a difference in philosophy…I don’t consider making people learn about git configuration a positive :P

though I suppose the real question is why git on macs isn’t configured by default to ignore .DS_Store globally…
Indeed, this looks like a reasonable feature request to whoever distributes your git for Mac.
